channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for UT

item.title: Report X-2023100815
item.description:
Report X-2023100815

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-08
  • City: NORTH SALT LAKE
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver noticed that a hazmat package that was loaded into his truck had a wet spot and was leaking. I came and pulled the hazmat from the truck and placed it in a hazardous red tote and brought it to the QA cage to process the damaged hazmat. DescribePack: Liquid leaked from the lid on bottle. You can see the streaks on the outside of the bottle left from the liquid. Upon inspection the lid was secured on the bottle which points to the lid being possibly defective. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Put in a hazardous red tote and brought to the QA cage to be processed.

item.title: Report X-2023100423
item.description:
Report X-2023100423

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-28
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: WEARING FULL PPE AND FOLLOWING DECISION TREE RESPONDED TO TENDER STATION, RESPONDER PLACED PACKAGE IN LINED SPILL TRAY AND RETURNED TO PROCESSING CENTER FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON INSPECTION OF CONTENTS, DISCOVERED HIGH VOLUME HYDROGEN PEROXIDE, RESPONDER SAW NO INDICATIONS OF HAZARDOUS MATERIALS PRESENT. HMSC CONFIRMED UNDECLARED STATUS. RESPONDER FOLLOWED UNDECLARED PROTOCOL.
